pr_title: fix: don't use queryId of last terminate command after restore

timeline.bodyText:
making this static is a design smell. if we need to access information from within this class we have two options (1) we can make compact return an object that is a pair of greatestQueryId and the List<QueuedCommand> (2) we can make RestoreCommandsCompactor non-static, and create the instance where we need it
you can read along https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7026507/why-are-static-variables-considered-evil for more reasons why
timeline.author: agavra
agavra

timeline.bodyText: this is breaking an abstraction barrier - we're relying on internal implementations of the string representation of the QueryId which doesn't guarantee that it will match the format that you assume here
timeline.author: agavra

timeline.bodyText: I'm guessing you didn't mean to keep all of these? This PR doesn't change the handleRestore syntax anymore (same throughout the PR)
timeline.author: agavra

timeline.bodyText: I feel like I'm blind, what's the difference between these two tests?
timeline.author: agavra

replies.bodyText: No you are not blind, I messes it up somehow. Fixed it though
replies.author: vpapavas

timeline.message: increase queryID only for queries, handle all terminate
remove my changes, fix test case
